auto_merge.commit_message:
Problem: Reconfiguring a float window applies the global 'winborder'.
Solution:
- Ignore 'winborder' when reconfiguring a float window.
- Still apply 'winborder' when converting a split to a float window.
auto_merge.commit_title: fix(api): don't use 'winborder' when reconfiguring float (#32984)

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

body:
Problem: reconfig-ing a floatwin applies the global 'winborder'.

Solution:
- ignore 'winborder' when reconfig-ing a floatwin.
- apply 'winborder' when converting a "split" win to a "float" win.

Fix #32974

comment_data.body:
This is way too much duplicate screen state. Can't you just use the previous floating window with `screen:expect_unchanged()`? (You need to assign the result of the previous `api.nvim_open_win` to `winid`)
```suggestion
      -- don't use winborder when reconfig a floating window
      config.border = nil
      api.nvim_win_set_config(winid, config)
      screen:expect_unchanged()
      command('fclose!')
```

comment_regular_data.body:
Again,
> should `'winborder'` apply to floating windows converted from split windows by `nvim_win_set_config`?

It may make sense to do this, since converting a floating window to a split window also erases border config.
It fixes at least the bug reported in #32974 I haven't checked the behavior related to splitting. Thank you all!
